intro: Bidens leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, alternate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with prominent white ray florets. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Bidens leptophylla is also known for its ability to thrive in wet conditions, making it a common sight in swampy areas.
